title: Widgets
text: Widgets are buttons within the POS that can be used for numerous different functions, such as: Price and Promotion Customers Stock Lookup Web Orders Article Statistics Customer Display Product Image Shop Logo SAFT Export Downpayment If you require a widget to be enabled, please contact K3 through your sales representative, or account manager, or by emailing your local support team. Widgets appear on the left-hand side when using a standard PC screen. On a mobile device or a small screen, the panel is converted into a button on the top bar. Tap to access the Widget menu. All the widgets are then displayed as a horizontal list of buttons. You can tap the icon of the widget you want to use. NOTE: The Revide widget is now deprecated and cannot be used within Imagine. If you need to integrate with Revide, please contact your K3 representative for further details. NOTE: The Price and Promotion Widget is a silent widget that processes your promotional rules as items are added to the basket. If the widget is not applied to your shop's POS, promotions will not take effect. Item prices set in PPE are not affected by this widget and will be applied irrespective of whether the Price and Promotion Widget is enabled or not. No configuration is required for this widget.
description:
Widgets are buttons within the POS that can be used for numerous different functions, such as:

  • Price and Promotion
  • Customers
  • Stock Lookup
  • Web Orders
  • Article Statistics
  • Customer Display
  • Product Image
  • Shop Logo
  • SAFT Export
  • Downpayment

If you require a widget to be enabled, please contact K3 through your sales representative, or account manager, or by emailing your local support team.


Widgets appear on the left-hand side when using a standard PC screen. 


 


On a mobile device or a small screen, the panel is converted into a button on the top bar.  Tap  to access the Widget menu.


All the widgets are then displayed as a horizontal list of buttons. You can tap the icon of the widget you want to use.



NOTE: The Revide widget is now deprecated and cannot be used within Imagine. If you need to integrate with Revide, please contact your K3 representative for further details.


NOTE: The Price and Promotion Widget is a silent widget that processes your promotional rules as items are added to the basket. If the widget is not applied to your shop's POS, promotions will not take effect. Item prices set in PPE are not affected by this widget and will be applied irrespective of whether the Price and Promotion Widget is enabled or not. No configuration is required for this widget.

title: Add a New Customer
text: To add a New Customer use the Widget to the left. Select Search Customer. The page will display a list of current customers. To add a new customer click. Add the customer's credentials and click. NOTE: Pressing the Tab when inputting the information will jump you to the next line. NOTE: See Customers Module / Settings in regards to E.126 format. The + symbol is added automatically after the number is entered when the E126 setting is enabled. When you have entered the information press "+ ADD" This will assign the customer to the transaction. After creation, the customer's details can be managed in the Customers module.
description:
To add a New Customer use the Widget to the left.



Select Search Customer.

The page will display a list of current customers. To add a new customer click.

 



Add the customer's credentials and click.


NOTE: Pressing the Tab when inputting the information will jump you to the next line. 


NOTE: See Customers Module /  Settings in regards to E.126 format. The + symbol is added automatically after the number is entered when the E126 setting is enabled.



When you have entered the information press "+ ADD" This will assign the customer to the transaction. After creation, the customer's details can be managed in the Customers module.

title: Customers
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Customer Widget Adding a New Customer Adding a Customer Address Customer History Customer Widget When you first log in to the POS you will see the Customer widget on the left-hand side of the screen. You then have the option to find the customer by inputting the customer number and clicking Find Customer. Selecting the search customer option allows you to search through the list of customers. At the bottom, you have the options to cancel, reset, filter and add new customers. Adding a New Customer To add a New Customer use the Widget to the left. Select Search Customer. The page will display a list of current customers. To add a new customer click Add the customer's credentials and click NOTE: Pressing the Tab when inputting the information will jump you to the next line. NOTE: See Customers Module / Settings in regards to E.126 format. The + symbol is added automatically after the number is entered when the E126 setting is enabled. When you have entered the information press this will assign the customer to the transaction. After creation, the customer's details can be managed in the Customers module. Adding a Customer Address With a customer attached to a transaction, within the widget menu select Shipping Address / Add new address, Fill in the Customers information as required. NOTE: Fields with * are required. By clicking this button, the selected address will be assigned as the customer's delivery address. This will cancel and close the page. Customer History When a customer is attached to a transaction you can view their purchase history by selecting This displays the list of receipts attached to the selected customer. Along the bottom of the window are some further options: Pressing this will cancel out the history view This allows you to filter the receipt history based on date, search string and whether to Search all stores. By default this displays 10 receipts,this option will load the next 10.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Customer Widget
  • Adding a New Customer
  • Adding a Customer Address
  • Customer History

Customer Widget

When you first log in to the POS you will see the Customer widget on the left-hand side of the screen.



You then have the option to find the customer by inputting the customer number and clicking Find Customer. 



Selecting the search customer option allows you to search through the list of customers.



At the bottom, you have the options to cancel, reset, filter and add new customers.

Adding a New Customer

To add a New Customer use the Widget to the left.



Select Search Customer.

The page will display a list of current customers. To add a new customer click


Add the customer's credentials and click


NOTE: Pressing the Tab when inputting the information will jump you to the next line. 

NOTE: See Customers Module /  Settings in regards to E.126 format. The + symbol is added automatically after the number is entered when the E126 setting is enabled.



When you have entered the information press this will assign the customer to the transaction. After creation, the customer's details can be managed in the Customers module.


Adding a Customer Address

With a customer attached to a transaction, within the widget menu select Shipping Address / Add new address,



Fill in the Customers information as required. 


NOTE: Fields with * are required. 



By clicking this button, the selected address will be assigned as the customer's delivery address. 

This will cancel and close the page.


Customer History

When a customer is attached to a transaction you can view their purchase history by selecting


This displays the list of receipts attached to the selected customer.



Along the bottom of the window are some further options:
Pressing this will cancel out the history view
This allows you to filter the receipt history based on date, search string and whether to Search all stores.
By default this displays 10 receipts,this option will load the next 10.

title: Stock Info
text: The Stock info widget shows stock quantity figures across the whole set of related variants. This is useful to see which variants you have low stock of in order to re-stock the shop by. Or to advise a customer if they cannot find the exact variant they are looking for, which alternatives you have in your shop. In contrast, the Article Statistic widget shows current quantity values for the item selected in the PoS. These statistics match the same values shown in Inventory - Figures. The key use of the Article Statistic widget is to see a specific items quantities across a range of metrics over a range of shops. This is useful for a customer who is looking for a particular sized and coloured item that you do not have in stock, but you can advise of other shops that may have it. In use, when adding an item to your transaction in the POS, the Widget panel will provide you with the currently available quantity for that particular item. For example, if you see "Stock (0200000002336)," it means that you are using the Stock widget, and the barcode for the item is "0200000002336." This information displays the amount of stock you currently have in each store (on hand), including offline stock or stock in transit. For more detailed inventory figures and statistics for this specific item, you can refer to the Article Statistic widget. You can utilise the Shops and Variants button to see other variants related to this item and their stock quantities. It allows you to also view the corresponding values in a Matrix Grid across all your shops. To see another shop you should choose from the list provided above the matrix grid. Note: only active shops will show their stock. Inactive shops will not appear in the list. Note: any inactive items will not display a quantity, like the Small Blue variant in example here. In contrast, all Large variants simply have no stock in the Brighton shop currently but are active items.
description:
The Stock info widget shows stock quantity figures across the whole set of related variants. This is useful to see which variants you have low stock of in order to re-stock the shop by. Or to advise a customer if they cannot find the exact variant they are looking for, which alternatives you have in your shop.


In contrast, the Article Statistic widget shows current quantity values for the item selected in the PoS. These statistics match the same values shown in Inventory - Figures. The key use of the Article Statistic widget is to see a specific items quantities across a range of metrics over a range of shops. This is useful for a customer who is looking for a particular sized and coloured item that you do not have in stock, but you can advise of other shops that may have it.


In use, when adding an item to your transaction in the POS, the Widget panel will provide you with the currently available quantity for that particular item.


For example, if you see "Stock (0200000002336)," it means that you are using the Stock widget, and the barcode for the item is "0200000002336."


This information displays the amount of stock you currently have in each store (on hand), including offline stock or stock in transit.


For more detailed inventory figures and statistics for this specific item, you can refer to the Article Statistic widget.



You can utilise the Shops and Variants button to see other variants related to this item and their stock quantities. It allows you to also view the corresponding values in a Matrix Grid across all your shops. To see another shop you should choose from the list provided above the matrix grid.


Note: only active shops will show their stock. Inactive shops will not appear in the list.

Note: any inactive items will not display a quantity, like the Small Blue variant in example here. In contrast, all Large variants simply have no stock in the Brighton shop currently but are active items.

title: Web Orders
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Web Orders Print the Last Pick List Dispatch Note Web Orders Web Orders - These are dependent on an eCommerce provider managing web orders through the Imagine Public API. It assumes this work has been performed already and this document refers exclusively to the Widget operation in the POS. If the order is "Click and Collect" as in it is already fully paid, the order should be posted to us with a 0 price. If the order is "Pay On Collection" the order should have the price posted with it so the payment can be processed through the POS. To see a list of your web orders, press the button on the widget. The POS will then list all your open Web Orders. Tap the order and it will display the customer details and items for that web order. You have 3 options available. Print Picklist - See Print Picklist for details. Skip - Press this if the items are not available, or you are unable to fulfil the order. Add To Basket - Press this to progress through the order. Once the order is in the basket, you can complete the transaction like you would any other sale - including if the price is 0. Print Last Pick List The picklist is used to gather all items together for a customer web order on the POS. After clicking on the Print Pick list from the list of orders, a full preview of the order will be displayed including the quantity ordered and the number available in stock. From the Pick List preview you can Print as Receipt - This will print the item details and quantities on a picklist to the receipt printer Print to A4 - This will create an A4-sized preview and allow printing to any A4 printer available to the client. Dispatch Note After payment is completed in addition to the normal receipt options, a button will be displayed to print a dispatch note. Tapping this will display a preview of the dispatch note. This dispatch note can be printed to any A4 printer available to the client. Re-Print Dispatch Note The dispatch note can be reprinted at any time from the Find Receipt function. The Dispatch Note Footer can be edited in Admin Receipt Setup.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Web Orders
  • Print the Last Pick List
  • Dispatch Note

Web Orders

Web Orders - These are dependent on an eCommerce provider managing web orders through the Imagine Public API. It assumes this work has been performed already and this document refers exclusively to the Widget operation in the POS.


If the order is "Click and Collect" as in it is already fully paid, the order should be posted to us with a 0 price.


If the order is "Pay On Collection" the order should have the price posted with it so the payment can be processed through the POS.


To see a list of your web orders, press the button on the widget.



The POS will then list all your open Web Orders.



Tap the order and it will display the customer details and items for that web order.



You have 3 options available.

  • Print Picklist - See Print Picklist for details.
  • Skip - Press this if the items are not available, or you are unable to fulfil the order.
  • Add To Basket - Press this to progress through the order.

Once the order is in the basket, you can complete the transaction like you would any other sale - including if the price is 0.

Print Last Pick List

The picklist is used to gather all items together for a customer web order on the POS.


After clicking on the Print Pick list from the list of orders, a full preview of the order will be displayed including the quantity ordered and the number available in stock.



From the Pick List preview you can

Print as Receipt - This will print the item details and quantities on a picklist to the receipt printer

Print to A4 - This will create an A4-sized preview and allow printing to any A4 printer available to the client.



Dispatch Note

After payment is completed in addition to the normal receipt options, a button will be displayed to print a dispatch note.



Tapping this will display a preview of the dispatch note.



This dispatch note can be printed to any A4 printer available to the client.


Re-Print Dispatch Note


The dispatch note can be reprinted at any time from the Find Receipt function.



The Dispatch Note Footer can be edited in Admin Receipt Setup.

title: Article Statistic
text: The Article Statistic widget shows current quantity values for the item selected in the PoS. These statistics match the same values shown in Inventory - Figures. The key use of this widget is to see a specific items quantities across a range of metrics over a range of shops. This is useful for a customer who is looking for a particular sized and coloured item that you do not have in stock, but you can advise of other shops that may have it. In contrast, the Stock info widget shows stock quantity figures across the whole set of related variants. This is useful to see which variants you have low stock of in order to re-stock the shop by. Or to advise a customer if they cannot find the exact variant they are looking for, which alternative you have in your shop. Within this widget you are able to see article statistics for your shop or for another shop. Select the desired shop from the drop down menu and the statistics will be updated automatically. Quantity In Transit The number of units in transit between shops, awaiting completion of the transfer. Specifically, this is the quantity of items that have been transferred out from the shop but have not been received at the 'transfer in' shop. Once the receiving shop has transferred this item(s) in then the stock is no longer deemed as 'In Transit'. Quantity On Hand The number of units currently in stock, including Reserved but excluding Offline. Quantity On Purchase Orders The number of units requested from a vendor but not yet delivered. Quantity Reserved The number of units reserved for customer collections, such as web orders. Note: see the Item Figures page for more details about the figures given on this widget
description:
The Article Statistic widget shows current quantity values for the item selected in the PoS. These statistics match the same values shown in Inventory - Figures. The key use of this widget is to see a specific items quantities across a range of metrics over a range of shops. This is useful for a customer who is looking for a particular sized and coloured item that you do not have in stock, but you can advise of other shops that may have it.


In contrast, the Stock info widget shows stock quantity figures across the whole set of related variants. This is useful to see which variants you have low stock of in order to re-stock the shop by. Or to advise a customer if they cannot find the exact variant they are looking for, which alternative you have in your shop.



Within this widget you are able to see article statistics for your shop or for another shop. Select the desired shop from the drop down menu and the statistics will be updated automatically.


Quantity In Transit
The number of units in transit between shops, awaiting completion of the transfer. Specifically, this is the quantity of items that have been transferred out from the shop but have not been received at the 'transfer in' shop. Once the receiving shop has transferred this item(s) in then the stock is no longer deemed as 'In Transit'.
Quantity On Hand
The number of units currently in stock, including Reserved but excluding Offline.
Quantity On Purchase Orders
The number of units requested from a vendor but not yet delivered. 
Quantity Reserved
The number of units reserved for customer collections, such as web orders.


Note: see the Item Figures page for more details about the figures given on this widget

title: Customer Display
text: If you are using hardware which has a secondary display you can have the Customer Display widget enabled. Pressing the button will pop open a new window for your custom display and will be formatted in line with the settings you perform in Admin. If you are using Google Chrome you can install our Chrome extension which will automatically pop the window to the right screen.
description:
If you are using hardware which has a secondary display you can have the Customer Display widget enabled.

Pressing the button will pop open a new window for your custom display and will be formatted in line with the settings you perform in Admin.



If you are using Google Chrome you can install our Chrome extension which will automatically pop the window to the right screen.

title: Product Image
text: The Product Image Widget displays an image of the product when set up via in the Image Media Library. Tapping the image will show a bigger version of the image in the main receipt panel
description:
The Product Image Widget displays an image of the product when set up via in the Image Media Library.



Tapping the image will show a bigger version of the image in the main receipt panel

title: Shop Logo
text: The Shop Logo widget will display the logo defined against your shop as configured in the Backoffice module. No additional configuration is required.
description:
The Shop Logo widget will display the logo defined against your shop as configured in the Backoffice module. 


No additional configuration is required.

title: SAFT Export
text: The SAFT export will only display on the POS if the Norway fiscalization has been enabled. To perform an export from the Imagine POS go to the top right ellipsis. From the menu choose. The POS window will now display the Print SAFT Report Screen, which is presented below: To generate the report, follow these steps: Select the desired Start Date and Finish Date. Please note that the reports run from the Start Date at 00:00:00 to the day after the End Date at 00:00:00. So, if you want to include the End Date in the report, set the end date 1 day forward. Enter the Company Name in the designated field. Click on the "Download" button. The report will be generated with a file name in the following format: SAF-T Cash Register_MVA_{DateTime).xml.
description:
The SAFT export will only display on the POS if the Norway fiscalization has been enabled.


To perform an export from the Imagine POS go to the top right ellipsis.
From the menu choose.


The POS window will now display the Print SAFT Report Screen, which is presented below:


To generate the report, follow these steps:

Select the desired Start Date and Finish Date. Please note that the reports run from the Start Date at 00:00:00 to the day after the End Date at 00:00:00. So, if you want to include the End Date in the report, set the end date 1 day forward.

Enter the Company Name in the designated field.

Click on the "Download" button.

The report will be generated with a file name in the following format: SAF-T Cash Register_MVA_{DateTime).xml.

title: Downpayment
text: The Down Payment widget will be accessible once it has been assigned to the relevant shop through the Platform Admin > Tenants > Widgets Tab. Once added, users will be able to create and complete bookings directly from the POS. To process a booking in the POS, follow these steps: Select "New Booking" using the widget on the left side. The POS interface will turn pink, indicating that you are now in the Down Payment process. You will be directed to the customer page. Here, you can input the customer's email address or membership card number if available. NOTE: If the customer doesn't exist in your system, you can add a new customer. Enter the customer's email or membership details and confirm. Select the billing address associated with the customer. NOTE: If the customer requires a different address for delivery, use the "Add Address" button. Shipment Settings screen: Home Delivery: This option selects the delivery address from the previous screen. If unticked, the delivery fee will no longer be required. Allow Partial Delivery: When ticked, it allows the customer to receive a partial delivery if the supplier/seller has limited stock at the time. The rest of the items will be delivered once a new purchase order is received. Lease: When ticked, it indicates that the customer and seller have an agreement for monthly payments on the received goods. Delivery Fee: Specify the amount to charge the customer for delivery. Delivery Date: Enter the scheduled delivery date. Delivery Before Date: Check this box if the customer is willing to receive the delivery before the set delivery date. Order Note: Add any additional notes to the order. Once you have filled in the Shipment Settings, click OK> The shipment will now appear in the transaction line, along with the delivery cost (if applicable). Click the "Save Booking" button. You will be prompted to confirm the down payment. Upon confirming, you will be taken to a page where you can input the amount for the down payment. Select the billing address from the widget menu on the left. Choose the address already in the system or add a new one using the "Add Address" button. You will be redirected to the transaction page, where you can process the payment.
description:
The Down Payment widget will be accessible once it has been assigned to the relevant shop through the Platform Admin > Tenants > Widgets Tab.


Once added, users will be able to create and complete bookings directly from the POS.


To process a booking in the POS, follow these steps:

Select "New Booking" using the widget on the left side.



The POS interface will turn pink, indicating that you are now in the Down Payment process.

You will be directed to the customer page. Here, you can input the customer's email address or membership card number if available.

NOTE: If the customer doesn't exist in your system, you can add a new customer.

Enter the customer's email or membership details and confirm.


Select the billing address associated with the customer.

NOTE: If the customer requires a different address for delivery, use the "Add Address" button.




Shipment Settings screen:

Home Delivery: This option selects the delivery address from the previous screen. If unticked, the delivery fee will no longer be required.

Allow Partial Delivery: When ticked, it allows the customer to receive a partial delivery if the supplier/seller has limited stock at the time. The rest of the items will be delivered once a new purchase order is received.

Lease: When ticked, it indicates that the customer and seller have an agreement for monthly payments on the received goods.

Delivery Fee: Specify the amount to charge the customer for delivery.

Delivery Date: Enter the scheduled delivery date.

Delivery Before Date: Check this box if the customer is willing to receive the delivery before the set delivery date.

Order Note: Add any additional notes to the order.



Once you have filled in the Shipment Settings, click OK> The shipment will now appear in the transaction line, along with the delivery cost (if applicable).




Click the "Save Booking" button. You will be prompted to confirm the down payment.



Upon confirming, you will be taken to a page where you can input the amount for the down payment.



Select the billing address from the widget menu on the left.




Choose the address already in the system or add a new one using the "Add Address" button.



You will be redirected to the transaction page, where you can process the payment.
